meanings.definition: Provide financial support to (a person, organization, or activity)
meanings.sent1: The government subsidises farmers to help them grow more food.
meanings.sent2: The scholarship subsidises students' education costs.
meanings.sent3: The charity subsidises the local animal shelter, ensuring all pets find loving homes.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness subsidises the community with warmth and care.
meanings.sent5: The grant subsidises the arts, allowing creativity to flourish.

meanings.definition: Pay part of the cost of producing (something) to reduce prices for the buyer.
meanings.sent1: The company subsidises the production of eco-friendly products to make them affordable.
meanings.sent2: Supermarkets often subsidise fresh produce to offer lower prices to customers.
meanings.sent3: The bakery subsidises the cost of bread, making it a loaf-ly deal for everyone.
meanings.sent4: His generosity subsidises the community with discounted goods.
meanings.sent5: The discount subsidises the purchase, making it a bargain for shoppers.
